Name: Calle Crisologo
OtherData: The town has successfully managed to preserve the historic district where you can still find calesas (horse-drawn carriages). Sample the famous and delicious Ilocos empanada, and walk along cobbled streets lined up with souvenir shops selling pottery and Abel Iloko weaves
CustomerReview: Vigan is a capital city of Ilocos Sur. The city was recently awarded as one of #sevenwondersoftheworld in 2015. Vigan is one of so many oldest city preserved from spanish colonial era. The city is very clean so many trash bins around the area, most museums are free entrance and tricycle and caleza are the most common transportation use conveniently can be find everywhere for a trip of 40 to 60 peso only.
